intro: Bradburya fasciculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf bradburya, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bradburya fasciculata typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
